result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Rebecca L. Maki-Wallander in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lexi M Kobs in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson appeared by phone for Lexi M Kobs.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 06:00 pm.
Judge grants Atty Jakobson's request to appear by phone for the August 16, 2022 hearing.
Attorney Jakobson request to appear by phone.
for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency - granted. Defendant to pay down payment of $150 and monthly payments of $50.

ADDRESS INFO for Lexi M Kobs
Current: 348 S Werner St, Adams, WI 53910 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2022)
Prior: 1352 21st Ave, Arkdale, WI 54613

Substantial Battery - Domestic  940.19(2)
Disorderly Conduct - Domestic   947.01(1)
Defendant shall have no contact with the following named person(s) or their residence(s): MAS 10-8-82 or LJS 5-10-81
EXCEPT the victim may waive the no contact provision by filing written permission for said contact with the Clerk of Circuit Court's office upon proof of completion of a Safety Plan with Hope House. 
Defendant shall immediately provide a DNA sample, pursuant to Wis.Stat.165.76(1)(gm), based on your arrest for a "violent crime" as defined in 165.84(7)(ab). As required in 970.0(8), you are hereby notified that you may request expungement of a specimen pursuant to 165.77(4).
Prosecuting attorney Brandon Ruffalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lexi M Kobs appeared by video.  Attorney Laura Tritt appeared by phone for Lexi M Kobs (special appearance)
